p: NPs can act in the organism at different levels. At intracellular level, they modulate signal transduction pathways through direct effects on the involved protein components (e.g enzymes, like kinases, regulatory proteins, membrane or intracellular receptors) ( Harvey & Cree, 2010), on DNA damage prevention ( Noroozi et al., 1998), on chromatin remodeling and epigenetic modifications ( Rahman & Chung, 2010). At extracellular level, they help to control or reduce inflammatory status ( Orlikova et al., 2014), cholesterol levels ( Chen, Wesley et al., 2005), or act on components involved in specific diseases, like hypertension ( Balasuriya & Rupasinghe, 2010).
